remarks: Apply a group homomorphism to a group sum, mapping version with implicit substitution.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ gsummhm2 as of 6-Jun-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
gsummhm2OLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. Mnd ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.k $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. B |-> C ) e. ( G MndHom H ) ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> X e. B ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.w $e |- ( ph -> ( `' ( k e. A |-> X ) " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.1 $e |- ( x = X -> C = D ) $.
gsummhm2OLD.2 $e |- ( x = ( G gsum ( k e. A |-> X ) ) -> C = E ) $.
gsummhm2OLD $p |- ( ph -> ( H gsum ( k e. A |-> D ) ) = E ) $.
$d A k x $.
$d B k x $.
$d C k $.
$d D x $.
$d E x $.
$d G x $.
$d H x $.
$d X x $.
$d k ph $.
